availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Constantin Riendenger (Campbell County, Kentucky, liquor retailer and soldier.)

body.p: Campbell County, Kentucky, liquor retailer and soldier. Native of the Grand Duchy of Baden. Married to Catherine Ritter Riedenger. Father of Constantin Riedenger. Served in the 42nd Kentucky Enrolled Militia (U.S.A) as private from September 2, 1862 to September 17, 1862. Liquor retailer in Campbell County in 1864. Liquor retailer in Campbell County in 1865.

ab.bibl:
Internal Revenue Assessment Lists for Kentucky, 1862-1866 NARA RG 58, Microfilm Series M768, Roll 16, Campbell County, Kentucky, 1864, p. 76.

Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), p. 872.
